p: In this study, it was observed that total cholesterol was significantly higher when rats became diabetic. In the diabetic treated groups with the ethanolic extract root of A. conyzoides ( Table 4), a significant ( p < 0.05) reduction in plasma cholesterol level was observed in experimental compared to the diabetic untreated group. The higher dose of the extract of 500 mg/kg (93.6 ± 1.2) exerted a more significant ( p < 0.05) reduction compared to the 250 mg/kg (98.4 ± 1.6). There was a gradual decrease in triglyceride levels in the A. conyzoides-treated groups against the diabetic untreated group. A significant ( p < 0.05) increase was observed in diabetic treated groups' triglyceride levels compared to normal control and diabetic groups.
